meanings.definition: To form or organize into a squadron.
meanings.sent1: The birds were squadroning in the sky, flying together in perfect formation.
meanings.sent2: The military was squadroning their planes for an upcoming air show.
meanings.sent3: The ants were squadroning around the picnic leftovers, ready to carry them away.
meanings.sent4: The students were squadroning into groups for the class project, each with a specific task.
meanings.sent5: The dancers were squadroning on stage, moving in sync to the music.

meanings.definition: The act of grouping or organizing into a squadron.
meanings.sent1: The squadroning of the ships was a magnificent sight on the open sea.
meanings.sent2: The squadroning of the troops showed their strength and unity in battle.
meanings.sent3: The squadroning of the toys on the shelf made it look like a miniature army.
meanings.sent4: The squadroning of the geese in flight painted a beautiful picture against the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The squadroning of the cars in the parking lot made it easy to find our vehicle.
